intro: Cyclodium confertum, commonly known as the broad-leaved cyclodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open grasslands. Cyclodium confertum is adapted to arid environments and is relatively drought-tolerant.
